content.raw: The values here are in the same order of magnitude as the tolerance. Maybe travelling a longer time could give us a more precise test?

update.description: Adds an odometry class that calculates odometry for a two wheel diff drive vehcile.
update.title: Odometry

content.raw:
I think it's okay to integrate the x, y, heading values every call and only update the velocity values when the elapsed time is not zero.

Most likely, if the time is zero then the x,y, and heading values haven't changed.
content.html:
I think it's okay to integrate the x, y, heading values every call and only update the velocity values when the elapsed time is not zero.

Most likely, if the time is zero then the x,y, and heading values haven't changed.

content.raw: `dt` doesn't change between line 115 and here. My question is whether we could just return false early then. But I don't think it's very important. It's just that we're throwing away the iteration, but still changing `this->dataPtr->leftWheelOldPos` above.
content.html: dt doesn't change between line 115 and here. My question is whether we could just return false early then. But I don't think it's very important. It's just that we're throwing away the iteration, but still changing this->dataPtr->leftWheelOldPos above.

content.raw: I think they were trying to compare against zero. I've also changed the `if` to check for zero.
content.html: I think they were trying to compare against zero. I've also changed the if to check for zero.

update.description: Adds an odometry class that calculates odometry for a two wheel diff drive vehcile.
update.title: Odometry

content.raw:
I moved the computation of `dt` to link 117 so that it doesn't include the time consumed before this `if` statement.

The comment above this `if` statement is incorrect. I originally took the wrong ROS code, and this got left over. I'll change the comment.
content.html:
I moved the computation of dt to link 117 so that it doesn't include the time consumed before this if statement.

The comment above this if statement is incorrect. I originally took the wrong ROS code, and this got left over. I'll change the comment.

content.raw:
I realize this comes from `ros_control`, but this check seems out of place, since integration already happened above. And it's weird that the old position is updated above this check, but time and speeds are below the check.

I'd expect this check to be moved to line 117, but maybe I'm missing something.
content.html:
I realize this comes from ros_control, but this check seems out of place, since integration already happened above. And it's weird that the old position is updated above this check, but time and speeds are below the check.

I'd expect this check to be moved to line 117, but maybe I'm missing something.

update.description: Adds an odometry class that calculates odometry for a two wheel diff drive vehcile.
update.title: Odometry

content.raw:
Since this class is specific to diff-drive vehicles, how about calling it `DiffDriveOdometry`?

Also, we may want to document all the assumptions made here. `X`  is forward, wheels are aligned, and so on.
content.html:
Since this class is specific to diff-drive vehicles, how about calling it DiffDriveOdometry?

Also, we may want to document all the assumptions made here. X is forward, wheels are aligned, and so on.

content.raw: What do you think of using `math::Angle` for all angles?
content.html: What do you think of using math::Angle for all angles?
